snippet: In overturning the punishment by his successor Roger Goodell, the former N.F.L. Commissioner Paul Tagliabue blamed the New Orleans Saints organization.
abstract: Paul Tagliabue, in a surprising rebuke of his successor as NFL commissioner Roger Goodell, vacates the suspensions of Jonathan Vilma, Will Smith, Scott Fujita and Anthony Hargrove, four players involved in New Orleans Saints bounty scandal; affirms Goodell’s finding that a bounty program offering money for hits that knocked opponents from games did exist, but shifts blame almost entirely to the Saints.
lead_paragraph: In overturning the punishment by his successor Roger Goodell, the former N.F.L. Commissioner Paul Tagliabue blamed the New Orleans Saints organization.

headline.seo: Tagliabue Lifts Player Suspensions in Saints Bounty Case
headline.main: Tagliabue Lifts Suspensions but Not Blame in Bounty Case
headline.print_headline: Tagliabue Lifts Player Penalties, Not Bounty Blame
